website_summaries.verdict: Improve the sound quality of your studio, auditorium, or gym with professional acoustic control.
pros: These high-end panels reduce echoes, fluttering, and residual sounds for an acoustic blank slate
The pack is available in packs of 12 or 24 in a variety of different color schemes, each featuring the modern and sleek wedge design
cons: Some users have noted inconsistency in tile thickness

customer_reviews.title: Good part of a system
customer_reviews.text: Bit thin on the valleys and difficult to attach without copious amounts of spray adhesive but surprisingly effective! No more screaming children across the hall!( when paired with closed cell foam weather stripping)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately this order quality was bad...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered from this seller before, this particular batch of 12 tiles were all "holey", which might not seem like a big deal, but it is when you using the foam to make an accent wall in your apartment. Some holes were as big as 1/4 an inch, as if some rodent chewed through them or something. Ordered another batch, hopefully quality will be better this time.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: No quality control
customer_reviews.text: All 12 panels were ridddled with holes, wouldn’t use another brand if I could go back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thin, but great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 sets to put on my wall in front of my editing station. I'm a video pro, not necessarily an audio pro, but I do have ears. The main reason I got these was to add a bit of professional looking decoration to my office. I can tell they help with the acoustics also.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Better microphone acoustics in an appartment
customer_reviews.text: 1 inch thick foam panels have about 3/4 inch grooves. These are light panels and are flexible enough for corners. I attached mine to the apartment wall using Velcro. For each panel I cut a 1 inch square of Velcro Industrial Strength and adhered the Velcro sticky part of the felt side to the acoustic panel. The hook part of the Velcro could have been attached to the wall, but Instead Poked a flat thumbtack. I used two squares of Velcro for each panel.
customer_reviews.author: drivemaster

customer_reviews.title: Received 5 that had tears in the foam.
customer_reviews.text: 5 pieces of the 2 sets of 12 had tears in them making them useless. Disappointing. The foam seems decent for the intact pieces I received. A little thin, but I expected that.
customer_reviews.author: JasonP

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent panels for a home studio or alike
customer_reviews.text: They're pretty decent panels for what it's worth. By far they're not professional grade, but I think they can do well for a small home studio. They are fairly thin, so initially it's going to absorb higher frequencies better than lower frequencies, so keep that in mind. What I did to hang mine safely without causing damage to the walls: I purchased 12"x12" Medium Weight Chipboard sheets and used 3M spray adhesive to stick the foam to the board. Then, I used 1 4lb rated velcro command strip (per each panel) and put it on the wall. It's holding fairly well, and because it's a velcro command strip, you can make slight adjustments as needed.
customer_reviews.author: AaronJK

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and helps keep the eco in my room down. I attached them to a big piece of cardboard with spray adhesive, then used command strips to attach the cardboard to the wall to avoid damage to the paint since I rent.
customer_reviews.author: Frieder Schnell

customer_reviews.title: I love these but my package only came with 6
customer_reviews.text: I love these but my package only came with 6, all my packages came with 6 when I was buying them from here... if it is advertised as a 12 pack I wanted the 12 pack but no I only got 6.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Levine

customer_reviews.title: They Look Good
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy these for function. I bought them because my walls are blank and my new apartment looks like an institution with these blank walls and I'm too broke to afford proper art or decent picture frames. These filled out one wall behind my computer setup nicely. I have no idea if they help with sound quality. I consider it money well spent. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Placed these bad boys on cardboard and command stripped the cardboard to ...
customer_reviews.text: Placed these bad boys on cardboard and command stripped the cardboard to the wall so it wont leave marks. Only thing I need is more of these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great Functionality, Totally Eliminates Sound Reverberation
customer_reviews.text: These are surprisingly good at isolating sound and preventing reverberation of sound off of the walls. I purchased a TON of these to outfit a room in my apartment for the sole purpose of a YouTube/Twitch/Film recording studio. As such I needed a good solution that isolated the sound from bouncing off of the walls and causing an echo into my microphone. These did the trick and well. Despite being only 1" thick these work and I don't feel that it's necessary to upgrade to a 2" foam panel.
customer_reviews.author: Rounie

customer_reviews.title: it came with 12 pieces instead of 24 like advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I only received half of what i was supposed too..it came with 12 pieces instead of 24 like advertised..frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for reducing outside noise
customer_reviews.text: I use these to reduce the noise coming in from my windows. I live on a busy street and work swing shift. I can hear the road noise in the morning and it wakes me up. So I ordered these and glued them onto a piece of cardboard and put them in between my window and blinds. They have cut down the road noise considerably. I no longer hear road noise and sleep through the morning with no issues. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K

customer_reviews.title: These came in one grey color
customer_reviews.text: In the picture (and the YouTube video that linked this product) showed a variation of color (black, grey etc) when I received these they are all grey. No black, no contrasting colors. If its going to come all grey, or mixed we should have the option to choose or at very least let us know that the item shown most likely won’t be what we’ll receive. Now I’m going to have to purchase these from somewhere else to get the darker & black foams. Other than that the packaging, quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: KissLips

customer_reviews.title: They work okay.
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price point, these are really difficult to beat. Sure you could spend more and get better sound dampening, but honestly I like the way these look and they really help in my bedroom with the surround sound and sub. Before installing, there was wall vibration that could be heard at higher decibels, and I had a clock that would rattle annoyingly. After installing 2 kits of these, The sound is noticeably softer, the volume seems to be more equalized at various frequencies and my roommate complains less. Will probably buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Dont bother
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible for sound dampening. They seem to just be reused packing foam labeled something else.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: this is a good product. I shoot YouTube videos and bought these ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a good product. I shoot YouTube videos and bought these to dampen the reverb in the small, 10x10 room. They definitely helped but were not as effective as higher end products from Auralex. These work as well as any normal foam you can buy, like egg crate foam. They are great for the price. The high end acoustic foam will cost at least twice as much for the same amount of square footage. These are cheap and effective. I would recommend these for a budget but I like my Auralex foam better for the sound control they have.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Looks Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Bought a bunch of this and it looks awesome. Sound dampening abilities are limited given it's only 1". If you're not on a budget consider something like Auralex foam, but if you are a normal person without tons of money, this is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Rausch

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect a whole lot from one pack.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my apt door, hoping to dampen the sound of other doors closing in the hallway outside. I'm not sure if I can tell much of a difference since putting them on. Additionally, these don't stay stuck very well, or I went way too easy on the adhesives. I was using 1" command strips in each corner. Gradually, they keep falling off, but that's less of this products fault and more of just trying to adhere to foam.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah S.

customer_reviews.title: Not same color
customer_reviews.text: I was gonna give this 2 stars but really 2.5 stars so I rounded up. This product I order was 1 pack of 12 and it came with the same 1 tiny hole but it didn't bother me as much but it has it. Then I realized I needed more so I ordered more. Then the second one came a completely different color. It is blue and black but it had a bit more glitter shine and didn't match the same colors which are weird considering I ordered the same one a day after. overall they look awesome but again color wise it doesn't bother me just you can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony o.

customer_reviews.title: A good night's sleep thanks to these.
customer_reviews.text: I stacked them in my bedroom window to decrease parking lot noise such as car locking "beeping" at 3 AM. They do the job, and aren't obtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E. Weitzel

customer_reviews.title: Work well for the price range!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for light acoustic treatment in a rented rehearsal space. Originally intended on using a lot more adhesive (3M command strips) to mount these, but after pulling them apart, realized they were lightweight enough to mount with early any adhesive. These work well for budged treatment of high frequency slapback, but not nearly as effective as deeper, heavier foam. For more intensive applications, or even something like monitoring (not band in room rehearsal), I'd recommend getting heavier panels, like 2-3" Don't be fooled, the packaging will look like there are much fewer panels, but they're really in there once you pull them apart!
customer_reviews.author: Tim O

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic acoustic panels for the price!
customer_reviews.text: These Ice blue acoustic panels arrived on time and without any damage. They are certainly not studio-grade, but they are worth the price! I tacked them onto the back wall of my office in a cool pattern. It looks really nice and the tinny echo that I was getting from my computer speakers is gone. They are easy to work with but a bit fragile. The dimensions are exactly as described on the page. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: K Lowder

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive alternative to higher quality acoustic panels
customer_reviews.text: These are budget acoustic panels and are quite lightweight. If this is the best you can afford, they will help with the sound a little bit. Please note that these are NOT for soundproofing. If you need higher quality for your purposes, spend the extra money and invest in denser foams such as Auralex.
customer_reviews.author: Young

customer_reviews.title: Solved a Problem
customer_reviews.text: These tiles solved a strange problem. My dog suddenly became very irritated by, apparently, some high frequency sounds coming from my TV. I couldn't hear the sound, but he was being seriously stressed by it. It was sad to watch him in such discomfort. I tried various things, but nothing helped. I got these tiles, put them under and around the TV. Problem solved. The tiles absorbed the high frequency waves or sound or whatever. My dog is calm, and I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tenley

customer_reviews.title: Very thin and doesn’t work well for me
customer_reviews.text: Very very thin and not dense at all. This is my first home studio project so I didn’t want to go super expensive but these were middle of the road on pricing But the quality is not good at all. I even had some pieces that were cut on the back side.
customer_reviews.author: HYoung

customer_reviews.title: So far I'm not disappointed. I covered my doorway (which is hollow and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to keep some echoing problems I was having under control, help keep from driving everyone in my house insane with games and music, and for looks. So far I'm not disappointed. I covered my doorway (which is hollow and let's sound right through) with these panels (used about half of my order) and there's a massive difference already. Packing was not great. I realize it's just foam but I'd hate to ship anything else like these were shipped. The box looked beat to crud and was falling apart. That could be UPS, I don't know. Other than that, no damage, and they areally exactly as you'd expect
customer_reviews.author: Marc C.

customer_reviews.title: Little noise absorption
customer_reviews.text: These are squares of very light foam. The 12 panels combined weigh only 10.8 oz, less than an ounce each. I purchased them to dampen the noise from a fireplace fan and them made little if any difference. As a test I held one over a stereo speaker and there was no noticeable difference in the sound. One reviewer commented that he liked the "look" for his audio room. If you want a "look" these may do the job. If you want noise absorption try a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sandvig

customer_reviews.title: Good for Home Entertainment Systems
customer_reviews.text: These are not the kind of foam that you will get from a music store or find in music studios. This foam is thinner and less dense than the professional quality stuff. However, a few of these tiles strategically set up around the house can make ambient noise and reverberation off the walls notably less intense. I bought these to help with the road noise from the street in front of my house and to help with the noise from the AC and the reverb from the TV. Even these few tiles widely spread out make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Aric Castro

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these guys provide a pretty good option for the home studio. No, they’re not as great as the expensive noise reduction foam, but they definitely do the job. They don’t come with anything to stick them to the wall, which is ok as you can use double stick tape, or choose to permanently adhere them with some spray glue. I like that they’re more decorative than the egg crate.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip kennedy

customer_reviews.title: not good for anything bigger than
customer_reviews.text: more decorative than functional.... it does "kill" some of the bounces, but not as much as the thicker material does. Borderline OK for a small room or vocal booth, not good for anything bigger than that
customer_reviews.author: GMMHEIL

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made and Each Charcoal Panel Had a Defect - Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Every charcoal panel had a defect. The panels have clean holes straight through that look like a manufacturer's defect. These foam panels are overpriced for what they are, especially when considering the condition that they're in when you receive them. I would suggest doing some further research and buy something else. In terms of sound absorbency, I believe that I would need more than 12 in order to notice a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: I had bought some that were thicker but more expensive which I really liked so that’s what I’m comparing this to. These look pretty good on my walls. I got 24 of them and set them up in panels of 6 (2x3) and I like the look. The only thing is that it didn’t help kill the echo as much as when I bought 12 thicker ones that I put in another room. I can barely tell the difference but it is there. It’s not a bad buy but if your sensitive to sound echoes while your talking with family or watching movies then go for thicker ones. Still no regrets and they look cool.
customer_reviews.author: Horacio Montes

customer_reviews.title: Dubious Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: The greatest bonus is that the holes and tears in the foam come free with purchase! But really, quality control is off the hook in all the wrong ways. I've also eaten soufflés that were denser than this foam. +10kHz high frequencies are slightly attenuated but besides that not much sound insulation is occurring since the panels are so thin. And the color? more of a medium gray than black. No, a repeat purchase will not be happening.
customer_reviews.author: christopher j.

customer_reviews.title: 30% Noise Reflection
customer_reviews.text: This product is decent for the price. I stream and play music in my office room and the reflections in here we're slightly challenging to solve; hardwood floor, 10' x 10' x 12' room with an angled ceiling. I bought a 12 pack of these and installed them 4 to a square. I installed them 40" from the floor and saw the most reduction in reflections. My room sounds a lot better considering what I paid for these. How I Installed: I took some black foam poster board and hot glued the 4 pads to a board then used command strips to hang them.
customer_reviews.author: xnMANBEARPiG

customer_reviews.title: Work as-expected
customer_reviews.text: I used 24 of these in my stairwell to prevent sound reflection from downstairs living room into my loft. It works well in reducing the sounds bouncing off the walls, up the stairwell, and looks fairly nice. Originally using 3M pull-n-stick double-sided tape, I upgraded to staple-gun after the tape started falling down. 4/5 stars since I wish the closed foam was tighter, giving it a more aesthetically appealing look.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: These do the trick!
customer_reviews.text: My office is located under a set of stairs. I have these on the wall. They buffer the sound and also keep others from hearing me. I like the color, too. Just make sure you get the commercial grade adhesive from a place like Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Bye Felicia

customer_reviews.title: Add some color to your room with some acoustic foam!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this foam exclusively for aesthetics in my office. The foam is decent quality for the price. However, some foam pieces do have larger holes and imperfections from manufacturing and also the tips of the blue foam have a greenish tinge to them (possibly from heat or the manufacturing process). I haven’t tested the acoustic capabilities of the foam, but for my purposes, the sound reduction is negligible. Overall a decent product to add some color to a room!
customer_reviews.author: TechOnDeck

customer_reviews.title: I don't think this does anything for acoustic dampening
customer_reviews.text: I really don't think these make a difference. I'm surprised people have had so much success and now I'm curious for actual acoustical ratings on these things. The biggest difference in my office has been getting a carpet and a couch. I read that if you can blow air through a fabric/substance, it probably won't block sound very well. Not sure that's a good measurement, but these don't really pass that test! These are just cheap foam, definitely not designed for acoustic dampening in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Soper

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Hmm...I havnet tested its sound dampening properties yet. I can say right out of the box, I can see that I waaaay overpaid for this item. They are basic foam panels with grooves cut in them. No more than that, Not sure why I just paid over $50.00 for this item.....wont happen again that is for sure. The amount you get, for the price you pay....nope.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome they are so lightweight because was able to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the most attractive panels to put on the walls of an office, but just hanging up a few in strategic locations seemed to really dampen the echo and keep voices from being carried. Even stuck a few on interior door and they have stayed put. Awesome they are so lightweight because was able to use small 3M Velcro picture hanging strips, cut in half longwise, and they stick great...only needed them at top corners since panels won’t be getting touched. Didn’t need any special glue. They are not attractive at all though... guess they could be covered over with something gauzy etc to camouflage and still not lose integrity.
customer_reviews.author: AE Miller

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy, bad quality and no effects.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. I have noisy roommate and I purchased many of these foams to cover the wall and door, however, I noticed no obvious sound reduction. This foam is so thin that sounds literally go through it. Quality control is also very bad with holes and varying dimensions. No use at all. I suppose most of the reviews are fake.
customer_reviews.author: Yifan Wang

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good considering the price, other higher grade / thicker acoustic foam can be expensive, and you may want to get that if your trying to soundproof a room, as I seen on some people trying to do on some of the negative reviews here. This foam is not for soundproofing, it is simply for absorption to stop echoes / reverberations of sound. So it work's great for a home studio on a budget. FYI, get some bass traps too, get about 8, and stack 2 in each corner of your room.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Phisher

customer_reviews.title: great value and does a good job
customer_reviews.text: Used this with Elmer's glue (spray) and poster board and constructed two panels and fastened to wall with another product that is removable. These panels absorb sound and are cheap and attractive. Went to Office Depot and bought black poster board so gaps would not show. Bought spray glue there as well as peel-able wall fasteners (tow way). Glued the panels after setting on floor and fiddling with color combinations. Trimmed poster board with box cutter. Entire assembly took about 30 minutes and fastened to wall in corner of room. This really cuts down echo. I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great sound foam for home use
customer_reviews.text: I can’t remember if these or the other set I purchased came in vacuum bagged, compressed form. So in case t is these, don’t worry! They will expand back to normal advertised 1” thickness after a few days, and they work great! If this is the set that didn’t come in vacuum bag style packaging, then it functioned just as well as the other! Can’t go wrong with it!
customer_reviews.author: Lane Swarts

customer_reviews.title: Great wall decor with the added bonus of canceling echos.
customer_reviews.text: My bedroom is a mix between my sleeping place and computer geek-room. I got these for wall decor that would also help cancel echoing due to playing loud music or gaming. My wall is too textured for adhesives, so I nailed them onto the wall with thin nails. I will use a black Sharpie to help hide the heads of the nails. These do NOT cancel sound to make next door rooms quiet, (as some sellers may advertise.) They help with canceling out echos in a room makes sounds more clear to a listener. I love the look of these on my wall, even if I don't need the function.
customer_reviews.author: The Buyer of Items

customer_reviews.title: Don't us off brand poster strips
customer_reviews.text: The foam is totally fine and functional. I read the reviews and bought poster strips to hang them, but since I'd need like, 24+ I went with the store brand version instead of the command strips. They lasted about a week before they've slowly started falling off the strips (strips still stuck to wall, not to foam). I considered gluing the strip to the foam, but remembered another review saying that glue literally dissolves the foam.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Quieted a poorly placed A/C return, perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: The previous owners of my house somehow decided an Air Conditioner return in the TV was a great idea. It's not. However, adding these acoustic foam squares and corners as a lining to the inside of the return, with a little spray adhesive, worked marvelously. Yes, we can still hear the thing, but it can no longer overwhelm the room or TV. They are made of soft, lower density foam, as opposed to tough, high density foam, if you were searching for that detail. They were perfect for my project. Thanks guys!
customer_reviews.author: Lee J. Pillow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound-deadening!
customer_reviews.text: Needed these for podcasting ... And they're PERFECT!! I lined my closet with them, and I'm amazed at the sound-deadening effects! It creates such a professional sound. This + my Blue Yeti sounded so quality, I was hired by a media company to be their podcast producer, because they wanted "the high quality sound" produced in my "studio". They had no idea that it was all beginner equipment!! And these sound panels really made all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Many methods! Few work. Wall paint dependent! XO
customer_reviews.text: Nice color! Difficult to install on the walls. I've tried direct spray adhesive, liquid nails, double sided tape, foam tape (a la go pro), and mounting them on cardboard or ply wood. Best so far is adhering them to cardboard or ply wood and using them to attach to the wall by command strips or some other method. :D I usedwith spray adhesive to attach them tile by tile to my wall. OR plywood of the correct size if you want to make a full panel. :D
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Reid

customer_reviews.title: For audio purposes, they work well. Really killed ...
customer_reviews.text: For audio purposes, they work well. Really killed the audio issues in my room (echo). That being said, the charcoal is more grey than black (despite the image), and the burgundy is lacking saturation as well. if youre going to function over form, they'll serve you.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: These work well if you use them for acoustic treatment.
customer_reviews.text: Soundproofing they are not. However, I used them on the wall around my corner desk in a room with hardwood floors. Echos were terrible and these brought that way down. Conference calls on my PC are no longer a pain where everyone is hearing the echo. I used command strips to hang them.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Not functional but decorative
customer_reviews.text: This product is clearly aesthetics and definitely not a functional means of damping sound. They look much nicer in the picture on the page than they do when in your custody. I will use them anyways because I don't feel like going to the hassle and returning this. If you're looking for serious sound dampening this isn't your product if you just want it for aesthetics then knock yourself out it's a good deal
customer_reviews.author: FreeAlienAlysis

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: So I needed 10 packages. They sent each package separately which seemed wasteful. Some were a bit chewed up but it happens. I used Gorilla Glue adhesive spray to put it up and some are coming loose already. I have a decibel level app, and these dropped the noise by 10 dB but I guess I was expecting more. I should say I have a home office in the basement and this went in front of the furnace to tone it down so I could talk on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great for echo
customer_reviews.text: I bought these this time for my home office wall, now I do not sound like I am taking my conference calls in the shower. I bought them before, in bulk, to cut the shrillness of my jack russell's bark which was terrorizing the neighbors eardrums in my apartment. They don't muffle the sound, they keep it from bouncing around. Use a staple gun to apply, and you won't regret hanging them later.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Reduces sound, difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: The sound reduction through the walls is a little helpful. However, they are kind of expensive so if you don't that many, then there are other parts of the wall that won't be sound proof. It was hard to set up. I didn't want to spend more money to buy things that make it stick to the wall so I used duct tape. They fall off occasionally, and get damaged easily because the foam material is soft.
customer_reviews.author: Honest opinions

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the fire retardant claim.
customer_reviews.text: Sound absorption works ok, but I dont trust the "fire retardant" claim. I put a piece near a candle outside to test, and the foam material immediately ignighted and sparked heavily.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Haven't installed them yet
customer_reviews.text: Someday (hopefully soon) I'm going to put these on the wall of a home recording studio where I plan to do voiceover work. I gave all the responses as 3 of 5 because, quite frankly, I haven't even removed the panels from the plastic packaging. They just arrived a couple of days ago, and I'm in a 14-day quarantine. So I haven't begun to think about finishing the voiceover studio or using the panels. This survey/questionnaire arrived WAY TOO prematurely. How 'bout contacting me in a couple of months when the pandemic is over??
customer_reviews.author: DTT

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you expect.
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind that these are not true studio quality sound absorbing foam. However, if you want to use these in your game room or media room to help reduce the echo and the amount of noise that travels to the rest of the house, then these are perfect! I used 3M Command tabs to install these and it worked like a charm. My only complaint is that I should have bought more. I really underestimated how little real estate these take up when placed correctly. Overall 5 stars, will be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Craig D.

customer_reviews.title: NOT for voiceover!
customer_reviews.text: NOT for any kind of VO work or studio. Thin and cheap. 0 absorbency. A case of "you get what you pay for". Will return ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: JillyT

customer_reviews.title: Decent budget foam
customer_reviews.text: Not going to blow you away or drastically trasnform your room acoustic. Works beat for cutting out highs, like from vocals or from flute but wont do anything to low bass frequencies. DONT BUY the blue ones. After only a couple months the blue panels have faded and discolored pretty significantly. Which is why i gave 4 stars. The black ones still look fine.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Esposito

customer_reviews.title: Decent foam for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to do. I have it hanging up in front of my computer, to reduce the echo off of my wall to my microphone. It definitely does the job that it's supposed to. You will need either Command Strips, Double Sided Tape, Glue, or Nails to hang it up. I used Command Strips to hang it up, and they work perfectly. My only complaint are that they aren't perfectly cut to each other, so you have to position them in such a way that they end up correctly together with no spaces.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: good acoustic modification
customer_reviews.text: this is not soundproofing material, but more acoustic material. it helps mellow out speakers. I am a minor audiophile. I attached 12 tiles (4'x3') to a 1/8" board using gorilla spray adhesive, (that indicates it is OK for foam on the can). it works. I affixed that board to the wall with one anchored screw. no problem. I then did 4 (3'x2') panels the same way. Minimal alteration to walls. no glue on walls. looks good and helps acoustics. My first attempt with elmers glue was a failure. I hope this helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient Bass Absorber
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 subwoofers in my Home Theater and bass reflectivitity has always been problematic. After installing these panels the full spectrum is clean and clear. There were small holes as noted by other reviewers but once they were installed on the walls, they are not noticeable. A worthwhile purchase for a high-volume amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened the package I thought I got shammed because of how small the bundle was. But they just reverse-stack the acoustics pads on top of one another. When you're holding it you immediately get a sense of low-quality based on how jagged the material feels in your hand. But once you mount it on the wall it looks great. A bit thin and a bit rough and in my sense not enough but decently tough. Also, you're gonna need some decent spray adhesive and some cardboard to mount these.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Webster

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I placed an order for a big lot of foam pads like these from this same seller and realized I was going to receive them very late and I needed it for my job right away so I tried to cancel the order so they obliged. I then ordered these which I worked out even better. Great quality and value for the price. I feel they absorb the sound quite well. Great product and seller. Item arrived promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Tree of Life

customer_reviews.title: Great looks and actually reduces echo!
customer_reviews.text: It reduced the echo in my room and also made it look minimalist style a little bit. Make sure you use a nice and strong double sided 3M tape for these bad boys! Now I can record my youtube song cover videos without having my neighbor passive aggressively jumping up and down and knocking on the apartment walls to low-key let me know I'm playing my guitar too loud!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: and are fine at helping a small room dampen the echo but ...
customer_reviews.text: I was less self-informed than I should have been when I bought these or I would have gone for higher quality panels at the time. That said, looking at the listing, it is upfront about what it is. They are thinner and lower in quality than many others but has a corresponding lower price. They are what they say they are, and are fine at helping a small room dampen the echo but I'll be buying different ones in the future
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Be aware: the color fades!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered more to add to my studio setup, and noticed that the color has faded over a year. See photo attached, the blue panel on bottom is after 1 year of use (now looks more green-ish), the blue panel on top-left is from what I just received... so now they don't match anymore, but they're the same product!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna F

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cut any noise
customer_reviews.text: There is no adhesive so I don't know how these are supposed to stay on. Secondly, I put them on a window so I don't have to hear my neighbors talking outside and I still hear them exactly the same. It did nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Yourfanclub

customer_reviews.title: Great sound displacement on feature wall.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for sound displacement in my husbands man cave. Looks great on his wall, color is exactly as described. What I will say is that there is a slight thickness difference in some of the tiles (some thicker than others). While this didn’t make a difference for us and our usage- someone who needed it for a professional use may have issues with it. Overall, 4 stars for a cool feature wall with a bit of sound-proofness. Not 5 stars due to lack of quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy V.

customer_reviews.title: Am i using this wrong?
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these to completely cover my door to keep the noise out my room but it does not work. My next door has the television sound to the max, so i have hard time sleeping at night. So, i thought this product would help. I have it completely cover with this foam, it does not help. I have to go to the next door still and ask them to lower the volume.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Worked for what I intended
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way it turned out. I didn't have any damaged tiles in my packaged as I noted in some others reviews, but I can see where on some they were cut pretty close to the edge so if you're not careful, they could easily tear. One other thing is highly recommend using the 3M Super 77 spray adhesive. May the install a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: RevJVegas

customer_reviews.title: Work as intended, reasonable
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Is there better buys? Yup, but for the price these feel very nice. Colors are consistent and you don’t get a mismatched manufacturing. I have a complaint with the overall quality of the foam and the angle of the valleys. Definitely a noticeable acoustic damping. Buyer beware: buying the colored sets in 24 is actually more expensive. Buying in 12 pack intervals was cheaper at the time of writing.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: adequate I suppose.
customer_reviews.text: when my package arrived there was a slit in the foam as shown above but there was no damage to the package. these got out past quality control these foams are very thin and flimsy but I have reinforced studio booth walls with insulation and other foams etc. these will serve their purpose and they were cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Heath M.

customer_reviews.title: Okay for what it is - sizes are not exact
customer_reviews.text: A little more pricey than other sellers in comparison to THICKNESS. The squares were not all exactly 12"x12", and some of the pieces had holes. I am soundproofing a room in my home for a home recording studio, and these pieces are being used on a foam board of insulation that is removable from the window. The colors are great. It does look nice. I can't fairly rate the sound absorption as I am using other soundproofing in conjunction with this order.
customer_reviews.author: Promarkp

customer_reviews.title: Getting them to stick was difficult...
customer_reviews.text: I live in a rental with old plaster walls so you cant even use a push pin it just breaks. I put a little bit of double-sided carpet tape and then used a glue gun to hold them up. The first couple of nights with just the tape I'd wake in the morning and find them on the floor. The hot glue gun worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: akakath

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend If You Are NEW!
customer_reviews.text: Ok! So I am new to the soundproofing game so, I thought why not just get some low price pads. Now, for the price I think they are just amazing but, when you put them on the wall you can hear right through them. I would get a thinker pair if I were you but, these work great if you just need a little soundproofing!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: Great panels at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: These panels work great for my son's room. He has a recording studio set up in there but we didn't want to attach the panels directly to the wall (and mess up the surface). We attached them to backing sheets first and then attached the sheets to a 2-sided frame. Similar panels were made to cover the windows creating a sound proof box in the corner that is also mobile. He's referred other musician friends to Amazon to purchase them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Courde'

customer_reviews.title: Purchase a larger quantity for moderate noise reduction
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved into a college apartment with vinyl floors, concrete walls, and a metal door. Needless to say, sound absorption became a priority for me as I tried to adjust to this prison-like living space. I purchased around 24 squares total of this foam for my small bedroom and found that some minor noises like opening drawers and footsteps escaped less from the room than before. However, I would strongly suggest purchasing enough to cover every surface if moderate sound reduction is your goal. The foam is very soft, lightweight, and somewhat dense. It is easy to stick on my concrete walls with double sided mounting tape.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Thin/not dense, see-though, worthless for intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: Classic example of "you get what you pay for". If you want to put some foam up and look like you're making room corrections, this is great for posing. If you want to use it as intended however, this stuff is worthless. Spend more for something that actually works...
customer_reviews.author: Trevor J. Smart

customer_reviews.title: Good for sound, average for cost.
customer_reviews.text: Good for sound, average for cost. I'd say this should cost about $12-$14. Also, why is sound foam so expensive? This should cost much at all to make and the design is extremely simple. This stuff (and other sound foam i've used) doesn't ever seem like it should cost nearly as much as it does.
customer_reviews.author: Brye Pitsenbarger

customer_reviews.title: Great for building my sound booth!
customer_reviews.text: Used these to turn my closet into a sound booth for recording my Voice Over work. Work very well and were easy to install. Although it doesn't cut out all external sound completely (i.e. you'd be able to stand in the closet and still hear faint noises), it does block it effectively so that the mic does not pick it up. The design also makes it easy to cut the sections into smaller pieces for a perfect fit. Would definitely purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: BrendanF

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but look good.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Exactly as listed - Not damaged or jagged - Smooth edges - Defined color Cons: - Price. It's just foam after all. - Some of these were oblong shaped very very slightly, but I was able to easily compress them on the wall to be square.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected, much less echo
customer_reviews.text: So much less echo in my home office now. They're not for "muting" sounds, so don't expect much from that; people outside the room can still hear me and I can still hear them. But there's no more worry about echoing on speakerphone conference calls or when I'm performing audio reviews. Exactly what I would expect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: KitsuneSoup

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and sounds better
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why it asks about adhesion... the product is advertised as backed. Used these for an office to improve the performance of my office microphone and am very pleased with the results. More accurate dictation, quieter atmosphere and it looks nice as well, very happy and will most likely buy again for other projects.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 12 pack. There are numerous amounts of holes throughout the entire set as well as having multiple tares. Very dissatisfied and disappointed. I also ordered some from another company for the same price and after comparing the two I can honestly say this product is awful. Do yourself a favor and take your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: ) They all arrived in a timely manner and in good condition. I had one that was torn slightly ...
customer_reviews.text: These seem to work well at stopping reverberation, echos, and deflection of sound in my recording studio. Just for the record these are not made for soundproofing anything. (You need different products for that.) They all arrived in a timely manner and in good condition. I had one that was torn slightly but I may have done that. They are not vacuum packed which I really liked. A couple were slightly discolored which is why 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound dampener!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a rather unusual project. The large return vent that goes to my furnace is very loud. It is right next to my living room too! I used command strips that hold up to 16 pounds and Scott mounting tape that holds up to 10 pounds to tape these to the inside of the vent all around. I applied the tape liberally so the foam won't come off. It actually made a huge difference in the sound and the airflow hasn't really changed! It was like turning a jet engine into a car engine!
customer_reviews.author: Mario Lucas Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work at all to muffle sounds coming from laundry room or to stop neighbors bass coming through the walls. Ended up throwing away.
customer_reviews.author: soccerstar666

customer_reviews.title: These things look awesome on the wall
customer_reviews.text: These things look awesome on the wall! Just as a warning, they do not actually soundproof your area. You have probably heard this a thousand times, and I even ignored what everyone said, so take it from me, THEY WILL NOT SOUND PROOF YOUR AREA. They still look really sweet on the wall and I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Adams

customer_reviews.title: Rockstar status
customer_reviews.text: These were great. Installed them behind my kids drumset in his bedroom as well as the back of his bedroom door. Great dampening! Cool colors. They cut well and the 3M/command strips work great with them. I bought the command poster strips at Home Depot and they were cheaper than Amazon. I also bought a couple 12x12 diamond plate squares to add to the mix. Looks like a rockstar!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny A Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Very Thing, Very Little Sound Absorption Noticed
customer_reviews.text: The price is right, but after about an hour of installing many of these in my studio, the old ear test shows almost no difference in sound dampening. My suspicion is that it's because these foam panels are so thin- almost like a pop filter thin. I could be wrong, this is just anecdotal, but not what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Coe

customer_reviews.title: Hit or Miss
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are serviceable panels. However, quality is hit or miss. Out of 24 panels, approximately have of them have significant imperfections. They ultimately get the job done, I guess, but the aesthetics have room for improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Does not absorb sount at all. Picture was misleading of the size and coverage. Would not buy it if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for home studio!
customer_reviews.text: Good starting point, I bough one and the reorder 2 times. Like them, look good, do their job, only a few details on some of them ( minor ones). I please them into wood panel for them to be removable. If you’re looking for sound absorbency and reducing noise For your home music studio, these are the ones to get!
customer_reviews.author: Pumbandad

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you can’t beat these. The ability to mix and match colors adds spice and decorum to your room. There is no adhesive included. I used fabric adhesive spray to stick to the wall without damaging my walls. This also allows me to reposition them easily. I plan on buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Paule P.

customer_reviews.title: Decent, looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: So at first it looked like I only got 6 out of the 12 foams and I was really mad, but they were actually flushed together so well that you couldn't tell... Which brings it to the point, they are only 0.5in thick, 1inch thick on the ridges. I put these on my door to dampen some sound and they look nice, and seem to dampen some sound, not the best but at least a little bit. I'd say they could definately be cheaper, if they're gonna have random cuts in them like mine and a lot od other people's have. Still 4/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Marko_K

customer_reviews.title: Thin & holes everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: There are holes everywhere and these are super thin (not quite 1 inch as described). I would pay a little more for higher quality ones.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny W. Chan

product_meta.title: Foamily 12 Pack- Acoustic Panels Studio Foam Wedges 1" X 12" X 12"
feature_bullets: Each WEDGE comes uncompressed and in prime condition! The Wedges in the photo will be exactly what you get.
Great for spot treating sound on walls in your studio or office - For use in recording studios, control rooms, Offices home studios, home entertainment theaters, Home Offices
12 Pack covers 12 square feet - Each tile is 1 square foot of 1 inch thick acoustic wedge
For professional acoustic control, sound dampening, acoustic treatment, noise reduction - Reduce waves, reverb and flutter echoes in smaller to medium sized rooms.

MADE IN USA - Passes the CA TECHNICAL BULLETIN CAL 117-2013: Requirements. This is the Procedure and Apparatus for Testing the Smolder Resistance of Materials Used in Upholstered Furniture. This product, passes the requirements tested in the CAL 117-2013 procedure

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars3,025 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
